text: Survivor Series (1999) was a professional wrestling pay-per-view show made by the World Wrestling Federation (WWF). It took place on November 14, 1999 at the Joe Louis Arena in Detroit, Michigan. It was the 13th Survivor Series event held by the WWF. The main event was a Triple Threat Match (a non- elimination match involving three wrestlers against each other), which saw Big Show defeat Triple H and The Rock to win his first WWF Championship. Big Show replaced Stone Cold Steve Austin, who was run down by a car at the event. The show also featured the WWF debut of Olympic gold medalist Kurt Angle, who defeated Shawn Stasiak. ==Matches== No. Results Stipulations Times 1 The Godfather, D'Lo Brown and The Headbangers (Mosh and Thrasher) defeated The Dudley Boyz (Bubba Ray and D-Von Dudley) and The Acolytes (Faarooq and Bradshaw) Four-on-four Survivor Series elimination match 9:36 2 Kurt Angle defeated Shawn Stasiak Singles match 5:57 3 Val Venis, Mark Henry, Gangrel and Steve Blackman defeated British Bulldog and Mean Street Posse (Rodney, Pete Gas and Joey Abs) Four-on-four Survivor Series elimination match 9:08 4 Mae Young, The Fabulous Moolah, Tori and Debra defeated Ivory, Luna, Jacqueline and Terri Runnels Eight-woman tag team match 1:52 5 Kane defeated X-Pac by disqualification Singles match 4:15 6 (with Terri Runnels) Four-on-four Survivor Series elimination match 14:27 9 The New Age Outlaws (Mr. Ass and Road Dogg) (c) defeated Al Snow and Mankind Tag team match for the WWF Tag Team
